thread.title: Punjab concede 3 points to MP

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Punjab concede 3 points to MP
text:
Patiala, October 25
Madhya Pradesh got three points by virtue of a slender first innings lead against hosts Punjab in a Ranji Trophy league encounter here today. The match tilted towards the visitors once they bowled out Punjab for 358 in response to their first innings total of 370. Having taken the crucial first innings lead, the visitors finished Day Three at 81/3, with an overall lead of 94 runs. On the final day, Madhya Pradesh turned in a solid batting display. They were comfortably placed at 314/6 when the play was called off. Former India A player Jalaj Saxena (95) anchored the innings on the final day as the visitors hung to their 3 points. Skipper Devendra Bundela (55 no) and Rameez Khan (54 no) added 112 runs for the seventh wicket to bat the hosts out of the game Gambhir abused Ganguly, Bengal: Tiwary New Delhi: Bengal captain Manoj Tiwary today alleged that his Delhi counterpart Gautam Gambhir and his teammates made unsavoury comments about former India captain Sourav Ganguly and Bengal, which upset him a great deal. The Bengal captain said the entire video footage of the incident would go to the BCCI. He said he has also spoken with Ganguly on this matter. “Yesterday, I spoke to him (Ganguly) and told him about the whole incident. He was very upset because somewhere his name was also raised and that is why I was also very upset about it. I felt really bad,” Tiwary told mediapersons after the match. Gambhir dismissed the allegations as Tiwary’s “figment of imagination”, and advised him to concentrate on his game rather than making sensational claims.— PTI Ranji Trophy Brief scores: J&K: 428 and 163/3 decl (B Singh 51 not out, ID Singh 40 not out; Rana Dutta 2/24); Tripura: 224 and 243/ (A Das 106 not out, P Singh 100 not out; P Rasool 1/54). Points: J&K 3, Tripura 1 Goa: 324 & 367/6d (S Kauthankar 101; R Dhawan 2/58); Himachal Pradesh: 376 & 125/2 (P Chopra 60; D Misal 1/13) Points: HP 3, Goa 1 Haryana: 170 and 262; Karnataka: 221 and 202/8 in 98 overs (R Uthappa 66, L Rahul 24; J Yadav 6/65) Points: Haryana 3, Karnataka 1 MP: 370 & 314/6 (J Saxena 95, D Bundela 55, R Khan 54); Punjab: 370. Points MP 3; Punjab 1.
